author: Eric Betz
description: Models show that an abrupt increase in carbon dioxide emissions would trigger feedback processes that would change Earth's hydrological cycle.
title: Surface Climate Processes Keep Earth's Energy Balance in Check

title: Global Warming Intensifies Drought Conditions in California

author: Mark Zastrow
description: New simulations of how thunderstorms drive electrical currents through the Earth's atmosphere combine precision with computational speed.
title: Lightning "Impulses" Improve Models of Global Electrical Circuit

title: Ice-Penetrating Radar Reveals Age of Greenland Ice Sheet Layers

description: Remote estimation of fluorescence emitted by plants can indicate variations in photosynthesis performance.
title: Airborne Sensor Can Track Photosynthesis Efficiency

title: Simulating a Warmer, Drier Arctic

author: Puneet Kollipara
description: Basing forecasts on data that preserve variations over space yield more reliable predictions than using standard numerical measures of climatic cycles' intensity.
title: What Climate Information Is Most Useful for Predicting Floods?

title: Past Phosphorus Runoff Causes Present Oxygen Depletion in Lakes

description: Hurricane Sandy moved a lot of debris, but where did it all end up?
title: Underwater Robot Tracked Ocean Sediment During Hurricane Sandy
